chapter_metadata.subject: English
chapter_metadata.chapter_name: The Lion, the Man and the Statue

questions.question: What were men and animals able to do long ago?
questions.answer: Talk to each other

questions.question: What was the lion proud of?
questions.answer: His strength

questions.question: What title did the lion give himself?
questions.answer: King of beasts

questions.question: What was the man proud of?
questions.answer: His intelligence

questions.question: According to the man, why can men capture lions?
questions.answer: Because men are more intelligent

questions.question: Where did the man take the lion to prove his point?
questions.answer: To a big garden

questions.question: Who was the hero shown in the statue?
questions.answer: Hercules

questions.question: What was the lion doing in the statue?

options.text: Lying dead at the hero's feet

questions.answer: Lying dead at the hero's feet

questions.question: What did the man claim the statue proved?
questions.answer: That men are greater

questions.question: According to the lion, why did the statue look like that?

options.text: Because it was made by a man

questions.answer: Because it was made by a man

questions.question: If lions made statues, what would they show?

options.text: A lion and man as friends
A man lying dead under a lion's paws

questions.answer: A man lying dead under a lion's paws

questions.question: What is the main lesson of the story?

options.text: A story depends on the storyteller

questions.answer: The story depends on the storyteller

questions.question: Which 'pr-' word from the story means feeling self-satisfaction?
questions.answer: Proud

questions.question: Which 'pr-' word means to show something is true?
questions.answer: Prove

questions.question: What does the story tell us about men and animals today?

options.text: They cannot talk to each other now
They live in the same houses

questions.answer: They cannot talk to each other now

questions.question: What is the plural form of 'glass'?
questions.answer: Glasses

questions.question: What is the plural form of 'fox'?
questions.answer: Foxes

questions.question: Complete the comparison: 'A sun is ______ than the moon.'
questions.answer: Brighter

questions.question: Why did Raju pull his puppy's tail?
questions.answer: He thinks it's fun

questions.question: Why did the leopard wander into the city?

options.text: The forest had been cut down

questions.answer: A big part of a forest near the city had been cut down

questions.question: What is the plural of 'paw'?
questions.answer: Paws

questions.question: In the story, what did the man use to argue his point?
questions.answer: A statue

questions.question: What word is the opposite of 'stronger' in the context of the trees exercise?
questions.answer: Shorter

questions.question: Who does Mia fear in the exercise section?
questions.answer: Dogs

questions.question: What should Roma wear for festivals according to her Granny?
questions.answer: A sari

questions.question: Who speaks first in the story?
questions.answer: The lion speaks first in the story.

questions.question: What did the man show to the lion?
questions.answer: The man showed the lion a statue in a big garden.

questions.question: What was the lion proud of?
questions.answer: The lion was proud of his strength.

questions.question: Who speaks last in the story?
questions.answer: The lion speaks last in the story.

questions.question: What was the man proud of?
questions.answer: The man was proud of his intelligence.

questions.question: What is the moral of the story?
questions.answer: The moral is that the point of view of a story depends on who the storyteller is.

questions.question: Find two words beginning with 'pr-' from the story.
questions.answer: The two words are 'proud' and 'proves'.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'proud'?
questions.answer: Feeling deep pleasure or satisfaction as a result of one's own achievements or qualities.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'prove'?
questions.answer: To demonstrate the truth or existence of something by evidence or argument.

questions.question: Write a sentence from the story that shows men and animals cannot talk now.
questions.answer: Long ago, men and animals could talk to each other.

questions.question: Write a sentence from the story that shows lions do not make statues.
questions.answer: If lions made statues, they would show the lion standing and the man lying dead under his paws.

questions.question: What would a lion's statue show?
questions.answer: It would show the lion standing and the man lying dead under his paws.

questions.question: Where was the statue located?
questions.answer: The statue was in a big garden.

questions.question: Who was Hercules?
questions.answer: Hercules was a great hero shown in the statue.

questions.question: What did the hero have at his feet in the statue?
questions.answer: He had a dead lion at his feet.

questions.question: Underline the nouns in: 'Once a man and a lion got talking.'
questions.answer: The nouns are 'man' and 'lion'.

questions.question: Underline the nouns in: 'I am the king of beasts.'
questions.answer: The nouns are 'king' and 'beasts'.

questions.question: Underline the nouns in: 'At last, the man took the lion to a statue in a big garden.'
questions.answer: The nouns are 'man', 'lion', 'statue', and 'garden'.

questions.question: What is the plural of 'bus'?
questions.answer: The plural of bus is buses.

questions.question: What is the plural of 'tree'?
questions.answer: The plural of tree is trees.

questions.question: What is the plural of 'brush'?
questions.answer: The plural of brush is brushes.

questions.question: What is the plural of 'box'?
questions.answer: The plural of box is boxes.

questions.question: What is the plural of 'match'?
questions.answer: The plural of match is matches.

questions.question: Change into a comparison: 'Stone is hard. Brick is hard.'
questions.answer: A stone is harder than a brick.

questions.question: Change into a comparison: 'Butterflies are colourful.'
questions.answer: Butterflies are more colourful than other insects.

questions.question: Why didn't the person eat the mango in the exercise?
questions.answer: The mango was sour; that is why I didn't eat the mango.

questions.question: Why did the farmer beat the camel?
questions.answer: The camel was eating the crops; that is why the farmer beat the camel.

questions.question: Why did Nu-Jo visit the earth?
questions.answer: Nu-Jo wanted to learn about humans; that is why Nu-Jo visited the earth.

questions.question: Why did the monkey jump into the lake?
questions.answer: A tiger was chasing him; that is why the monkey jumped into the lake.

questions.question: What plural sound is at the end of 'dogs'?
questions.answer: The 's' sound is at the end of 'dogs'.

questions.question: What plural sound is at the end of 'buses'?
questions.answer: The 'es' sound (iz) is at the end of 'buses'.

questions.question: Make a phrase using the noun 'garden'.
questions.answer: A big garden.

questions.question: Make a sentence using the noun 'statue'.
questions.answer: The statue was made of white marble.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'Lions are ________ than men.' (Strength)
questions.answer: Lions are stronger than men.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'Men are ________ than lions.' (Intelligence)
questions.answer: Men are more intelligent than lions.

questions.question: Why did some students find the test difficult?
questions.answer: It was a surprise test; that is why some students found it difficult.

questions.question: What is the QR code text on Page 1?
questions.answer: X24NVP.

questions.question: What did the man claim the statue proves?
questions.answer: He claimed it proves that men are greater than lions.

questions.question: How did the lion reply to the man's claim?
questions.answer: He replied quickly that it only shows the statue was made by a man.

questions.question: What is the plural of 'branch'?
questions.answer: The plural of branch is branches.

questions.question: What is the plural of 'eyelash'?
questions.answer: The plural of eyelash is eyelashes.

questions.question: Complete the comparison: 'Mouse is ______ than the lion.'
questions.answer: The mouse is smaller than the lion.

questions.question: Complete the comparison: 'Books are ______.' (Interest)
questions.answer: These books are more interesting than those.

questions.question: What happened to the forest near the city?
questions.answer: A big part of the forest had been cut down to build the city.

questions.question: Why does Mia not play with dogs?
questions.answer: Mia is afraid of dogs; that is why she doesn't play with them.

questions.question: Why did the narrator not play with dogs in the exercise?
questions.answer: The dogs are dull; that is why I don't play with dogs.

questions.question: What does 'king of beasts' refer to?
questions.answer: It refers to the lion's belief that he is the ruler of all animals.

questions.question: What is the plural of 'dish'?
questions.answer: The plural of dish is dishes.

questions.question: What is the plural of 'class'?
questions.answer: The plural of class is classes.

questions.question: Who made the statue in the story?
questions.answer: The statue was made by a man.
